Recommendation: Ragnarok Online
This is a old Free To Play RPG from beginning to end with 2D sprites navigating in a 3D world environment. You can play solo and ignore other players if you wish or you play with others. It's an open-ended world and you aren't forced down a path or route to get to some ending. But like real life, some people get frozen when there are too many choices! Ragnarok Online is open to the point where you can play a mage who fights with a weapon and eschews magic most of the time. I cannot say that is efficient or effective, but RO will let you play like this if you want because your choices in life are yours to make.

http://renewal.playragnarok.com/gameguide/helpfulstartguide.aspx

>I try to login on the specific page of Ragnarok Online
>"not allowed to see the content"

I don't know what kind of error message that is since you paraphrased it, but online games such as Ragnarok Online (RO) need you to have an account before you can login to an account. Running the RO client puts up that login page.

I assume you don't have an account, so it is time to Register an account so that you can login to it. At the top of the RO page at:
http://renewal.playragnarok.com/gameguide/helpfulstartguide.aspx

You see REGISTER at the very top. Click that to go to new game account registration: https://www.warpportal.com/account/registration.aspx

Once you create your Warp portal account, you can then create login accounts for each game that is run by Warp Portal of which the PC game "Ragnarok Online" is one of them. So, after you are logged into your Warpportal account, you then create a game account login for Ragnarok Online. After you do that, you can then run the RO client and login to the game account.

posts.com:
Decode this: ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK

A Twitter snowflake ID is a 64-bit binary number, with 41 bits representing a timestamp, 10 bits representing a machine ID, and 12 bits representing a per-machine sequence number. The snowflake ID is generally serialized in decimal format and is used in the post URL.

For example,
https://twitter.com/i/status/1581674019991916545
Decoding 1581674019991916545:
{'creation_time_milliseconds': 1665935447105,
'datacenter_id': 10,
'machine_id': 337,
'sequence_id': 1,
'server_id': 17}

The filename of a Twitter photo also contains a base64-encoded snowflake ID. This can be decoded into a regular snowflake ID, although it contains three "extra" unknown bytes.
For example,
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q?format=jpg
FdMR2WDaMAMPt2q -> 1572620320212922371

It is unknown if the filename of a Twitter video also contains a snowflake ID. You can see the URL contains it, but any off-platform video would would only contain the file name.
For example,
https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1564378065198882816/pu/vid/960x720/ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK.mp4

How would "ENT1yWWhLL-Qz9mK" be decoded into a snowflake, if it's possible?

Resources:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowflake_ID
https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#snowflakes (good visualizations, twitter uses another epoch)
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xVrPoNutyqTdQ04DXBEZW4ZW4A5RAQW2he7qIpTmG-M/edit

>Anything really, as long as it just gets the brain working.
>Ideally though I'm looking for less calculator based stuff and more mental maths, the sort that can come up in daily life.
learn how to use basic math to estimate or calculate numbers quickly. for example:
you want to estimate 190x71
190 = 200-10, 71 =70+1

then a quick estimation would be 190x71 ~= 200x70 = 2x7x100x10 = 14000.
for a better estimation, you substract 70x10 = 700, and you get 13300.
you get the final sum if you add 200-10 = 190: 13300 + 190 = 13490
what did I do here? I used the distributive property of addition and multiplication to make the actual calculation easier:
190x71 = (200-10)x(70+1) = 200x70 - 70x10 + 200 - 10


the actual calculation on paper, step by step:
190x71 = (200 - 10) x (70 + 1) = 200x70 + 200x1 - 10x70 - 10x1
= 2x7x100x10 + 200 - 7x100 - 10
= 14x1000 + 200 - 700 - 10
= 14000 - 500 - 10
= 13500 - 10
= 13400 + (100 - 10)
= 13490
this calculation takes many steps, but a quick estimation is far quicker if you know how to do it and are able to keep the numbers in your mind.

how do you use this in real life? say you are paying a bill: you bought 190 items at 71 cents each, and you want a quick estimation of how much it should cost before paying (so you don't get scammed or whatever), then you do this quick mental calculation and are able to estimate the final cost BEFORE paying anything.

>>1308306
>how do I practice this and develop it?
>What are your ways of long division/multiplication anon? On paper, I need to remind myself of the best ways of those too.
these two are the same question, and have the same answer: learn and memorize the properties of the addition, substraction, multiplication and division, then apply them in convenient ways.


using the same example, >>1307851 . notice that I actually did more things than simply using the distributive property of +/*:

>200x70 = 2x7x100x10 = 14000
here, I applied the associative and commutative properties of multiplication to move the zeros to the end so that I could compute the most difficult calculation (2x7) first and then multiply that for 100x10 (which is easier than 2x7), which is not really a multiplication: it's a matter of adding 3 zeros to the right of 14. ask yourself, why do this? answer: to make both the memorization and calculation in my mind easier to myself.

>190x71 = (200 - 10) x (70 + 1)
again, I came with these numbers, ordered them and applied the properties of the operations (addition, multiplication, substraction) in a way I could make it easy to calculate the final result. I could have used other numbers, say:
190x71 = (150 + 40) x (60 + 11)
and it would be the same result with a different path for calculation, and, most importantly, a different difficulty (for me at least, multiplying anything by 11 becomes more difficult).
THAT is the magic of maths: you can use the numbers and its properties in different ways, you can then find the easier path and enf up with the result you want.

see, that multiplication could be made even more difficult:
190x71 = (127 + 33) x (94 - 23)
but, why do this?

get a basic maths book that teachers the properties of the basic operations (addition, multiplication, substraction, division), do its exercises, then practice the above with random numbers and random "pathways".

>>1307409
Gonna share what I've put together to keep my head straight while learning Maths. Haven't put it to the test for very long, so don't take it as gospel.

You don't necessarily have to start with Arithmetic-I didn't. Start with College Algebra and fill in the gaps in Arithmetic as you go. Actively try and point out what you don't know and figure it out. Make sure to follow along each example provided as well as do the problem sets. Instead of taking notes, I like to write questions, observations, thoughts, etc in the margins of the textbook I'm using. Keep a spare notebook around for your problem sets. You don't need to follow any of the charts shilled on /sci/, just whatever book is readily available to you or provided to you as part of a course. I'd recommend you enroll in a College Algebra course at your local community college.

You won't absorb everything you cover and you'll forget a sizable portion of what you learn after a while, so be mindful of reviewing every so often. Writing notes/comments in the margins comes in handy since you are able to readily see what you were previously stuck on and any insights you made while reading that you might've forgotten since you last covered the section. You are usually provided with insights upon your review of a section, so you'll pick up whatever yo covered more quickly.

PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE! No one can teach you anything; you have to apply you own way of thinking unto what you're learning.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1310246
I used a SD card to get the test run Japanese Ocarina of Time on my Wii, will that work?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1310252
OoT is a Wiiware/VC game you installed into your system from a wad. Disc based games are read from your memory source sorta like a disc is read. Placing your ISO on the SD card will work, but it's not recommend as the Wii's SD card reader is slooow, reading at 1-2MB/s. The ancient USB1 port reads way faster at 10-12MB/s, which is faster than the DVD drives read speeds.
But, you want to play NSMB. That'll be fine on a SD card, just try it out.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1309051
Yeah! ^.^ There are tons of books, movies, series, and manga that explore fusion as a character development device. Some of my faves include Ranma 1/2 (has transformation between humans and animals through special training techniques), Fushigi Yuugi, Kirigaya Suguha (it's about two people sharing a soul through special crystal technology), Revolutionary Girl Utena, Sailor Moon, Attack on Titan, and Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny (though this is more >.< to follow). All of these stories use fusion as an important part of their plotlines and explore its effects on the characters in meaningful ways. If you want to explore something with a little more romance, you could always check out some shoujo manga. There's tons out there that explore fusion and relationships in interesting ways. Hope this helps! <3

It is highly unlikely that you are experiencing a stroke. If the symptom persists, you may be experiencing a result of subluxations caused by the adjustment. Consulting with a medical professional is the best way to determine if this might be the case.

To prevent spammer accounts from continuing to post on your website after deletion, you should set up a system that checks for an active session every time a page is refreshed or an action is performed. posts.sub: low quality video render and preview, Vegas Pro
posts.com:
I use Vegas Pro to edit videos that I upload to youtube, notube io and freemake. I either upload my videos in MP4 HD or 720p HD, the problem is that the quality of the video preview is very, too low even if I change the settings. When rendering it's the same thing, the quality is very low, which gives a rather pixelated and blurry video. Even uploading the video to the video, the quality is still low, despite the 1080p HD...

Help

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Have you considered disabling smart resample and or disable the sampling in properties?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CzhjT9z0JcA

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1310002

Just cause you upload a higher resolution doesn't mean the bitrate will be preserved with the same higher quality. It sounds like you may have encountered a problem with data compression when rendering. Data compression works by reducing the amount of space necessary to store a given video file, resulting in lower video quality. To improve the quality of your videos, you should start by adjusting the bitrate of your video. Bitrate is the rate at which data is transferred from one point to another and it should be adjusted to the highest possible level. Additionally, you can experiment with other encoding settings such as frame rate, keyframe interval, and resolution. Lastly, you should consider using a third-party program to optimize your videos for the platform you are uploading them to.

posts.sub: Connecting a turnstile to an access control system
posts.com: Hi /war/, I'm coming from /g/.How do I connect a tripod turnstile to an access control system? Is there any programming required? The manual mostly talks about the tripod's functions and drilling proper holes in the ground.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1309946
You probably need to buy a more expensive one then. That one may well only be for enforcing one-way traffic.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1309946
>How do I connect a tripod turnstile to an access control system?

To connect a tripod turnstile to an access control system, you will need to connect the turnstile to an interface module. The module should have input and output capability that can be connected to the access control system. The interface module will then convert the signals from the turnstile into commands that your access control system can understand and use for controlling access rights.

Programming will be necessary in order to configure the interface module correctly. The manual should provide specific instructions for programming the module and connecting it to the access control system.

If you go to a game's page on itch.io, you'll find buttons to Download the game. I was wondering if there was a way to just get the direct download link from that button, instead of having to visit the itch.io page to download it?

Here's an example: https://itchio.itch.io/butler
In the case of the Download button, if you look at the href, it's just javascript:void(0)
Any way to get the direct download link from this page, or any other given game's page? Thank you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
They use some JS to obfuscte the links. To get a DDL you have to:
1. get value of the data-upload_id attribute inside of the element you found
2. make a post request to POST https://itchio.itch.io/butler/file/[data-upload-id]?source=view_game&as_props=1&after_download_lightbox=true (make sure to post the CSRF token)
3. You should receive a JSON with the URL
>https://w3g3a5v6.ssl.hwcdn.net/build/176634/672320-archive-default?GoogleAccessId=uploader@moonscript2.iam.gserviceaccount.com&Expires=1674479876&Signature=YKgVgeosSfRdHOwvImDNLsLomDVTVIn6CySHq%2B5F%2BTrRZ1MpxsP0taIsmIbXNj%2FpKtnV5u%2BTAV4lbwlIXnikFklsqUkHv13Xj2FRhFHZrzzMDnFn48mbgv0%2BVwrrSqNUvog4t1hH2BXCyICgJBqvEFDBZnexTBQJRYWE0Atzv4weOrvvuskxeTTyLtK61IzwjelTsp3MOfYH4Y4kJSYftSg7OogBUVPznR65%2FL7CqcQ1vZkLkYGxbJGFyVC2djBGLA%2FVkpGVlHF9exWn%2Fi%2BCcivWsZ8n5h1P8BqmKVmLzkLWw%2BOKbb48yC3D%2B5qiKh3oApb%2BZXgdx40BLBdnEN8hmQ==&hwexp=1674480136&hwsig=85bc2f181842eec68703c3b023f40c8c

But if you just want the link you can just watch the network from the dev tools and get the link from the first POST request you find.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Stop giving me a boner

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1309975
>the sort of grainy texture
That's just a GIF artifact. You can edit the colors without worrying about that, and they will come back automatically when you export the end result since the GIF format can only support a limited range of colors. It's just dithering to give the illusion of more colors.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>1309975
What you want is called palette swapping.

In gimp you might consider opening the gif, coying each frame to its own image, then using a tool like Colour | Map | Rotate colours or Alien map on the first image, and then apply those same settings to every other image, then recombine them.

I don't know of and I doubt there's any automated way to change the smooth gradient to a hard edge. That would require some sort of motion tracking and feature detection. It's especially unlikely that such a tool exists if you look at how the frames are stored. Instead you'd need to paint it manually which looking at the second image is what has happened.
